Text: I’m extremely saddened to hear of former Ohio House Speaker Bill Batchelder’s passing. I am grateful for his many years of service to Ohio. His family is in my prayers during this difficult time. https://t.co/SpF2SqHyem

Nuclear power is a safe, affordable, and carbon efficient source of energy that is critical to our nation’s grid. The Department of Energy's investment ensures that America will continue to be a global leader in preserving and protecting our planet. https://t.co/yTlBtuFurr

The first woman featured as a part of this program is Maya Angelou. An influence to so many, she is now the first black woman on the quarter & her legacy is permanently ingrained in our democracy. Thank you @RepBarbaraLee for your leadership, I was proud to work on this together.

Last night I had the honor of attending an event to commemorate the American Women Quarters Program and the first day of Black History Month. I am proud to be a part of this historic moment which brings incredible female leaders onto the face of our nation's currency. https://t.co/aSqzNYYhO3

Today marks the 179th birthday of President William McKinley, a Northeast Ohio native. President McKinley served our nation and Ohio honorably as a veteran, Congressman, Governor, and President. May we always remember his leadership and true devotion to public service. https://t.co/NhCERc4MiY

I also want to recognize our runners-up, Jenna Kunes and Avery Milhoan who teamed-up to create Plants4U. All three finalists are Eighth-grade students at Lake Middle School and have worked hard to deserve this special recognition.

Congratulations to Jordyn Holben, the winner of the Congressional App Challenge for Ohio's 16th district. Check out this tutorial of his app, Roots Through Rhythm. https://t.co/2X4SFQCdlC 

Fantastic job, Jordyn! We can't wait to see what you do next.
I have no doubt that Ohioans are up for the job and will welcome this remarkable opportunity. Congratulations to Governor DeWine and his entire team on this tremendous accomplishment!

In addition to adding Ohio jobs, Intel has plans to partner with local universities and foundations to invest $100 million for developing talent. This commitment will ensure that the chips produced at this facility truly are Ohio made.

Over the next 10 years, Intel could invest $100 billion to ensure this hub becomes the epicenter of semi-conductor production & the largest silicon manufacturing site in the world. The magnitude of this investment will make Ohio an international leader in this cutting edge tech.

It's hard to overstate how important today's announcement that Intel is bringing two chip factories to Ohio is for our economy. 3k direct jobs and thousands more across the state are expected in a critical industry to our economy and national security. https://t.co/RbkiqSPg8V

We remember and honor Cleveland native Charles McGee who passed away on Sunday at 102 years old. Brigadier General McGee was a Tuskegee Airman who served our national honorably from World War II to the Vietnam War. We are forever indebted to his remarkable service to our nation. https://t.co/4neL0cZjlU

The potential of Web3 is enormous and the biggest mistake we could make now is rushing to over-regulate a space that is in its infancy and so very few in Washington truly understand.

Fundamentally, Web3 is a computing revolution that has the potential to solve some of the internet's most frustrating problems by putting power directly in the hands of the builders and users who make it all possible. https://t.co/mDFhmONLCr

Today we have a hearing on digital assets and blockchain (web3). The bulk of commentary in Congress has been on individual assets and relating to the traditional finance world. This misses the bigger picture entirely.
